subtitle.en: Scientific Software Developer and Computational Biophysicist
subtitle.es: Desarrollador de Software Cientifico y Biofísico Computacional

content.en: As a Postdoctoral Associate at the Rice Center for Theoretical Biological Physics (CTBP) and a Molecular Sciences Software Institute (MolSSI) Fellow, I develop physics-based molecular models to investigate biological phenomena. I am a lead developer of several open-source force fields, including OpenAWSEM for protein dynamics, Open3SPN2 for DNA, and OpenActin for actin cytoskeletal networks. These models, written in Python and built on top of the OpenMM molecular dynamics framework, are designed following best practices in scientific software development with modular architecture, continuous integration workflows, and documentation accessible to beginners, advanced users, and developers alike. My current research focuses on optimizing force field parameters using machine learning, in direct collaboration with experimental laboratories to ensure that each model addresses well-defined questions in structural and cellular biology. I also actively support the training of the next generation of scientists through initiatives such as Science Clubs Peru, iGEM, and Frontiers in Science, where I guide students in interdisciplinary projects focused on biophysical model development. My goal is to create open-source, modular, reproducible, and sustainable computational tools that not only accelerate scientific discovery but also help build the infrastructure needed by the scientific community.
content.es: Como investigador postdoctoral en el Centro de Física Biológica Teórica de la Universidad de Rice (CTBP) y fellow del Instituto de software de ciencias moleculares (MolSSI), desarrollo modelos moleculares basados en principios físicos para investigar fenómenos biológicos. Soy un desarrollador principal de varios campos de fuerza open-source, como OpenAWSEM para dinámica de proteínas, Open3SPN2 para ADN y OpenActin para redes del citoesqueleto celular de actina. Estos modelos, escritos en Python, utilizan como base la librería de dinamicas moleculares de OpenMM y están diseñados siguiendo buenas prácticas de ingeniería de software, con arquitectura modular, integración continua y documentación accesible para todo tipo de usuarios. Actualmente trabajo en la optimización de parámetros de estos modelos mediante técnicas de inteligencia artificial en colaboración directa con laboratorios experimentales para garantizar que cada herramienta esté alineada con preguntas concretas en biología estructural y celular. También participo activamente en la formación de nuevas generaciones de científicos a través de iniciativas como Science Clubs, iGEM y Frontiers in Science, guiando a estudiantes en proyectos interdisciplinarios enfocados en el desarrollo de modelos biofísicos. Mi objetivo es crear herramientas computacionales modulares, reproducibles,  sostenibles y de codifo abierto que no solo aceleren el descubrimiento científico, sino que también creen la infraestructura que la comunidad científica necesita.

degree.en: PhD, Systems, Synthetic and Physical Biology
degree.es: Doctorado en Sistemas, Biología Sintética y Física

details.en: Dissertation: Mesoscale Models for the Study of Emergent Behaviors Arising from Protein Interactions
details.es: Disertación: Modelos de mesoescala para el estudio de comportamientos emergentes de interacciones de proteinas

degree.en: BSc. Chemistry. BSc. Pharmacy and Biochemistry
degree.es: Bachiller en Ciencia con mencion en Química. Bachiller en Ciencia con mencion en Farmacia y Bioquímica

highlights.en: Contributed to modular and reproducible scientific software in molecular sciences as a MolSSI Software Fellow.
highlights.es: Contribuí a software científico modular y reproducible en ciencias moleculares como Fellow de MolSSI.

en: Participated in the Software Best Practices Boot Camp at MolSSI HQ.
Developed infrastructure tools for computational molecular sciences.
Collaborated with Software Scientists in specialized training on maintainable and extensible code design.
es: Participé en el Boot Camp de Mejores Prácticas de Software en la sede de MolSSI.
Desarrollé herramientas de infraestructura para ciencias moleculares computacionales.
Colaboré con científicos de software en capacitación especializada sobre diseño de código mantenible y extensible.

entries.institution: Center for Theoretical Biological Physics, Rice University, Houston, TX

highlights.en: Lead developer of Python-based tools for protein analysis; mentoring students and presenting work internationally.
highlights.es: Desarrollador principal de herramientas en Python para análisis de proteínas; mentoría y presentaciones internacionales.

en: Developed Python packages for structure and sequence analysis using Pandas, NumPy, Scipy, PyTorch, Numba, Simpy.
Authored 3 peer-reviewed publications and presented research in 2 international conferences.
Mentored undergraduate and graduate students across interdisciplinary teams.
es: Desarrollé paquetes de Python para el análisis de estructuras y secuencias utilizando Pandas, NumPy, Scipy, PyTorch, Numba, Simpy.
Autor de 3 publicaciones científicas y presentaciones en 2 conferencias internacionales.
Mentoría a estudiantes de pregrado y posgrado en equipos interdisciplinarios.

highlights.en: Created coarse-grained models and simulation tools; contributed to 10 publications and 6 international talks.
highlights.es: Modelado de proteínas y simulaciones; contribución en 10 publicaciones y 6 conferencias internacionales.

en: Developed Python packages to model and analyze protein interactions.
Led a team of 4 developers on C++ scientific software.
Applied statistical modeling and machine learning to simulations.
Built a mathematical model of protein network connectivity.
Authored 10 publications, presented in 6 conferences, and delivered internal research updates.
es: Desarrollé paquetes en Python para modelado y análisis de interacciones proteicas.
Lideré un equipo de 4 personas en software científico en C++.
Apliqué modelado estadístico y aprendizaje automático en simulaciones.
Desarrollé un modelo matemático de conectividad en redes de proteínas.
Autor de 10 publicaciones, presentaciones en 6 conferencias y actualizaciones internas.

highlights.en: Built software pipelines for vaccine design and delivered technical updates to corporate leadership.
highlights.es: Diseñé pipelines de software para vacunas y presenté avances técnicos a líderes corporativos.

en: Created software tools for vaccine development using public bioinformatics databases.
Contributed to veterinary vaccine development projects.
Presented progress reports to executives and interdisciplinary departments.
es: Creé herramientas de software para el desarrollo de vacunas usando bases de datos bioinformáticas.
Contribuí a proyectos de vacunas veterinarias.
Presenté reportes de progreso a ejecutivos y áreas interdisciplinarias.

entries.institution: Bioinformatics Lab, Cayetano Heredia University, Lima, Peru

highlights.en: Developed bioinformatics tools and taught computational science in undergraduate and workshop settings.
highlights.es: Desarrollé herramientas bioinformáticas y enseñé ciencia computacional en cursos y talleres.

en: Built and used bioinformatics software for scientific research.
Curated and analyzed large-scale biological datasets with Python.
Managed GPU cluster server deployment and networking.
Taught classes and workshops on simulation, visualization, and scientific programming.
es: Desarrollé y utilicé software bioinformático para investigación científica.
Curé y analicé conjuntos de datos biológicos con Python.
Administré implementación y redes de clústeres de GPU.
Enseñé cursos y talleres sobre simulación, visualización y programación científica.

AWESOME
entries.description: Implementing modular python code for potentials in openMM, analysis tools in Python and machine learning optimization with PyTorch of the AWSEM forcefield by retraining it using high-throughput ΔΔG data.

entries.title: OpenFit
entries.description: Developed a molecular density fitting method that optimizes the correlation between experimental and simulated density maps. Implemented efficient algorithms for computing density maps and calculating derivatives for integration with MD simulations. Optimized code performance using Numba for high-speed parallel computations.

entries.title: OpenActin
entries.description: Developed a novel mesoscale open-source coarse-grained force-field to simulate actin network aggregation using openMM.

entries.title: DCA-frustratometer
entries.description: Co-led the development of a Python package to parameterize energy models from protein sequence data using Direct Coupling Analysis (DCA). The open-source code includes documentation, tutorials, unit testing, and CI with GitHub Actions.

entries.title: Percolation of actin networks
entries.description: Designed a mathematical model of percolation in actin networks based on connectivity and percolation of graphs.

entries.title: Open3SPN2
entries.description: Developed an open-source coarse-grained force-fields for DNA simulations in collaboration with Juan J. de Pablo group. Included version-control, documentation, tutorials, parameterized unit testing, continuous integration using github actions, and distribution through pip and anaconda including conda-forge, with force classes using inheritance from openMM forces. Forcefield was adapted from previous C++ versions from the code for LAMMPS and compared them using jupyter notebooks.

entries.title: OpenAWSEM
entries.description: Co-developed an open-source coarse-grained force-fields for protein simulations based on previous LAMMPS C++ code. Included version-control, documentation, tutorials, and distribution through pip and anaconda including conda-forge.

entries.title: Multivalent linker model in MEDYAN
entries.description: Designed, coded, and implemented a C++ plugin for a mechanochemical model of actin networks. Led a technical team of 2 graduate students and a computer scientist in collaboration with Gareg Papoian.

entries.title: Prediction of folding free energy based on sequence
entries.description: Applied Bayesian inference methods to predict folding free energy changes from sequence data.

entries.title: Acute myeloid leukemia outcome predictor
entries.description: Explored predictive models in Python to assess AML prognosis, utilizing random forests and evolutionary algorithms.

title.es: MolSSI Fellow en desarrollo de Software

issuer.es: Instituto de Software de Ciencias Moleculares (MolSSI)

description.en: 12-month fellowship for advanced graduate students and postdocs developing open-source software for computational molecular sciences. Trained in software best practices, and mentored by MolSSI Software Scientists
description.es: Beca de 12 meses para estudiantes avanzados de posgrado y postdoctorados que desarrollan software de código abierto para ciencias moleculares computacionales. Capacitado en buenas prácticas de software, y entrenado por científicos de software de MolSSI

description.en: Awarded the Shirley Chan Student Travel Grant to attend and present at the APS March Meeting 2021. Recognizes high-quality abstracts in sessions sponsored by DBIO
description.es: Beca de viaje Shirley Chan para asistir y presentar en la APS March Meeting 2021. Reconoce resúmenes de alta calidad en sesiones patrocinadas por DBIO

description.en: Advised Rice University’s iGEM team in computational modeling of the violacein biosynthetic pathwayfor non-invasive gut inflammation and cancer detection via photoacoustic imaging.
description.es: Asesoré al equipo iGEM de Rice University en la modelización computacional de la ruta biosintética de la violaceína sensibles a inflamación para la detección no invasiva de inflamación intestinal y cáncer mediante imagen fotoacústica.

entries.program: Diseña tu micro-mundo: Construye modelos en computadora para simular proteínas.
In-silico design and experimental testing of immunogenic epitopes as vaccine candidates
